treatment.reference: Methanocorpusculaceae fam. nov., represented by Methanocorpusculum parvum, Methanocorpusculum sinense spec. nov. and Methanocorpusculum bavaricum spec. nov. Arch Microbiol 151:381-390
treatment.description: Small, irregular coccoid cells usually occurring singly, < 1 µm in diameter. Flagellated and weakly motile. Gram negative. Cell envelope consists of a hexagonally arranged S-layer with a center-to-center spacing of the subunits of 16.0 nm. Glycoprotein subunits with an apparent molecular weight of 94000 are found. Strictly anaerobic and chemoorganotrophic. Methane is produced from H2/CO2, formate, 2-propanol/CO2 and 2-butanol/CO2. No growth and methane production observed on acetate, methylamines, methanol, ethanol, l-propanol, l-butanol and cyclohexanol. Optimal growth temperature 37 ˚C, no growth at or below 15˚C and at or above 45˚C. Optimal pH 7.0. Clarified tureen fluid obligately required for growth. The G + C content of the DNA is 47.7 mol% (Tm) and 51 mol% (HPLC). Isolated from anaerobic sediment of a wastewater treatment pond of the sugar factory in Regensburg (FRG).
